cities.name: Dushanbe
cities.facts: Dushanbe is the capital and largest city of Tajikistan, known for its beautiful parks and Soviet-era architecture.
events: Spring Festival at the National Museum
cities.desc: Dushanbe, the capital city of Tajikistan, is a vibrant cultural hub featuring beautiful parks, impressive monuments, and a mix of modern and Soviet-era architecture. The city is home to various museums, including the National Museum of Tajikistan, which showcases the country's history and heritage. Dushanbe is a clean, European-style city. The city is located in Gisar valley at 2,700 ft above sea level, and has wide tree-lined streets with plenty of cafés to enjoy coffee or tea with local sweets. Dushanbe is the financial, political, administrative, and cultural capital of Tajikistan. Much of Dushanbe's education system dates from Soviet times and has a legacy of state control; today the largest university in Dushanbe, the Tajik National University, is funded by the government. Dushanbe International Airport is the primary airport serving the city. Other forms of transport include the trolleybus system dating from 1955, the small rail system, and the roads that traverse the city. Dushanbe's electricity is primarily hydroelectric, produced by the Nurek Dam, and the aging water system dates from 1932. Tajikistan's healthcare system is concentrated in Dushanbe, meaning that the major hospitals of the country are in the city. The city makes up 20% of Tajikistan's GDP and has large industrial, financial, retail, and tourism sectors. Parks and main sights of the city include Victory Park, Rudaki Park, the Tajikistan National Museum, the Dushanbe Flagpole, and the Tajikistan National Museum of Antiquities.

cities.name: Khujand
cities.facts: Khujand is one of the oldest cities in Central Asia and is located at the confluence of the Syr Darya and Fan rivers.
events: Cultural events at the Khujand Historical Museum
cities.desc: Khujand, located in northern Tajikistan, is one of the oldest cities in Central Asia, known for its rich historical significance and cultural diversity. The city features the ancient Khujand Fortress and the bustling Panjshanbe Bazaar, where locals sell traditional crafts and produce. Khujand, city, northwestern Tajikistan. The city lies along both banks of the Syr Darya (river) at the entrance to the fertile and heavily populated Fergana Valley. One of the most ancient cities of Central Asia, it lay along the great Silk Road from China to Europe. Khujand is one of the oldest cities in Central Asia, dating back about 2,500 years to the Persian Empire. Situated on the Syr Darya river at the mouth of the Fergana Valley, Khujand was a major city along the ancient Silk Road. After being captured by Alexander the Great in 329 BC, it was renamed Alexandria Eschate and has since been part of various empires in history, including the Umayyad Caliphate (8th century), the Mongol Empire (13th century) and the Russian empire (19th century).[3] Today, the majority of its population are ethnic Tajiks and the city is close to the present borders of both Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan.

cities.name: Bokhtar
cities.facts: Bokhtar is a regional center located in southern Tajikistan, known for its agricultural products.
cities.desc: Bokhtar, situated in southern Tajikistan, is an important cultural and economic center. The city is known for its agricultural activities, surrounded by beautiful landscapes and mountains. It is a gateway to explore the nearby Pamir Mountains. Bokhtar (Tajik: Бохтар),[3] previously known as Qurghonteppa, Kurganteppa and Kurgan-Tyube, is a city in southwestern Tajikistan, which serves as the capital of the Khatlon region. Bokhtar is the largest city in southern Tajikistan, and is located 100 kilometres (62 mi) south of Dushanbe and 150 kilometres (93 mi) north of Kunduz, Afghanistan. As of 2019, the city's population was estimated at 110,800, making it the third-largest city in the country. The population fluctuates depending on the season, due to the many Tajik migrant workers in Russia. Along with the capital Dushanbe, Bokhtar is more demographically diverse than other major Tajik cities such as Khujand, Kulob or Istaravshan.[4] Its population includes Tajiks, Uzbeks, Russians, Pashtuns, Tatars, Ukrainians, Kazakhs, Greeks, and many more.[citation needed] The city had a large number of ethnic Russians who worked in the industrial and agricultural complexes in and around the city. Bokhtar is a stronghold of Tajikistan's political opposition.

cities.name: Kulyab
cities.facts: Kulyab is famous for its historical sites and as a center of Tajik culture.
cities.desc: Kulyab is a city in southern Tajikistan, rich in history and surrounded by stunning natural beauty. It features the Kulyab Fortress and is known for its traditional crafts, especially pottery. The city serves as a base for exploring the surrounding mountainous regions.

cities.name: Danghara
cities.facts: Danghara is known for its beautiful landscapes and is a great place for hiking.
cities.desc: Danghara is a picturesque small city known for its beautiful landscapes and agricultural richness. The area is famous for its local fruits and vegetables, and visitors can enjoy the scenic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys.

cities.name: Isfara
cities.facts: Isfara is famous for its rich history and as a center of the Tajik textile industry.
cities.desc: Isfara is a city located in northern Tajikistan, renowned for its cultural diversity and ancient history. The city is surrounded by stunning mountains and features several historic monuments, including mosques and madrasahs, showcasing the rich heritage of the region.

cities.name: Norak
cities.facts: Norak is known for the Norak Dam, one of the tallest in the world.
events: Water sports events at the dam
cities.desc: Nurek is famous for the Nurek Dam, one of the tallest dams in the world, providing hydroelectric power to the region. The surrounding area is known for its beautiful landscapes and outdoor recreational opportunities, making it a popular spot for tourists.

cities.name: Tursunzade
cities.facts: Tursunzade is an industrial city known for its aluminum production.
cities.desc: Tursunzade is an industrial city that plays a vital role in Tajikistan's economy. It features a mix of modern developments and traditional culture, making it an interesting place to explore. The city is also known for its historical sites and beautiful surroundings.

cities.name: Panjakent
cities.facts: Panjakent is famous for its ancient ruins and rich archaeological history.
cities.desc: Panjakent is known for its archaeological significance, being one of the ancient cities of the Sogdian civilization. Visitors can explore the ruins of ancient structures, as well as the nearby beautiful mountains and valleys that offer breathtaking views.

cities.name: Vose
cities.facts: Vose is known for its scenic mountains and outdoor activities.
cities.desc: Vose is a small city known for its agricultural activities and stunning natural beauty. The region is characterized by its picturesque landscapes, traditional Tajik culture, and friendly locals. It is a peaceful destination for visitors looking to experience rural life.

cities.name: Shahrinav
cities.facts: Shahrinav is known for its beautiful landscapes and opportunities for ecotourism.
cities.desc: Shahrinav is famous for its stunning natural landscapes and outdoor activities, making it a great destination for hiking, camping, and enjoying the tranquility of nature.

cities.name: Zarafshan
cities.facts: Zarafshan is known for its gold mining history and beautiful nature.
cities.desc: Zarafshan is known for its historical significance and beautiful landscapes. The city has rich traditions and is surrounded by picturesque mountains, making it a great place for outdoor activities and cultural exploration.

cities.name: Kurgan-Tyube
cities.facts: Kurgan-Tyube is a major city in southern Tajikistan with a rich history.
cities.desc: Kurgan-Tyube is a city in southern Tajikistan known for its agricultural development and rich cultural heritage. The city has a blend of modern and traditional elements, making it an interesting place to visit.

cities.name: Istaravshan
cities.facts: Istaravshan is known for its historical architecture and vibrant bazaars.
cities.desc: Istaravshan is one of the oldest cities in Tajikistan, known for its rich cultural heritage and numerous historical monuments, including the ancient Qala-i Sughdi fortress. The city is also famous for its traditional crafts, such as carpet weaving.

cities.name: Hissor
cities.facts: Hissor is famous for the Hissor Fortress and its scenic surroundings.
cities.desc: Hissor is known for its impressive fortress and historical significance. The Hissor Fortress offers panoramic views of the surrounding area and is a popular destination for those interested in Tajik history and culture.

cities.name: Tajikabad
cities.facts: Tajikabad is known for its rich agricultural lands and rural culture.
cities.desc: Tajikabad is known for its breathtaking mountain scenery and offers various opportunities for adventure tourism. The region is popular among hikers and those looking to explore the natural beauty of Tajikistan.

cities.name: Khorog
cities.facts: Khorog is the capital of the Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Region, known for its stunning landscapes.
cities.desc: Khorog is the administrative center of the Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Region and is known for its stunning mountain scenery and rich cultural diversity. The town is a popular starting point for trekkers and adventurers exploring the Pamir Mountains.

cities.name: Panj
cities.facts: Panj is located on the border with Afghanistan and has a rich cultural exchange history.
cities.desc: Panj is a small town located along the Panj River, known for its scenic beauty and traditional Tajik culture. The area is ideal for those looking to relax and enjoy nature, with opportunities for fishing and hiking.

cities.name: Farkhor
cities.facts: Farkhor is known for its fertile lands and agricultural products.
cities.desc: Farkhor is a small town known for its agricultural products and picturesque landscapes. It is a peaceful destination with a welcoming atmosphere, ideal for experiencing traditional Tajik life.
